poem:
Surrogacy Ring

In the shadow play of greed,  
women wear silent scars,  
their wombs marked, not by love,  
but by promises unkept,  
cash handed, then snatched  
as if dreams could weigh  
more than flesh and bone,  
an echo of cries lost  
in corridors of justice,  
where empty cradles swing  
beneath the whispered winds.
